metadata.title: CVE-2023-45677 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description: stb_vorbis is a single file MIT licensed library for processing ogg vorbisfiles. A crafted file may trigger out of bounds write in `f->vendor[len] =(char)'\0';`. The root cause is that if `len` read in `start_decoder` is anegative number and `setup_malloc` successfully allocates memory in thatcase, but memory write is done with a negative index `len`. Similarly iflen is INT_MAX the integer overflow len+1 happens in `f->vendor =(char*)setup_malloc(f, sizeof(char) * (len+1));` and `f->comment_list[i] =(char*)setup_malloc(f, sizeof(char) * (len+1));`. This issue may lead tocode execution.

criterions.comment: libstb package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
